page.title: 14Friston Forest Landscape
page.content: In Friston Forest rides of about 20 feet in width criss-cross the trees,acting as fire breaks as well as paths.Large sandy gallops are maintained on the far side of the forest and are used by a local stable to train their racehorses.Farmland on the western boundary is used for sheep and cereals,with heifers grazing on the Cuckmere water meadows.To seaward lies Exceat Country Park,with the Cuckmere winding down to the sea, and the Nature Museum.Local residents described glowworms seen in the Forest.
